result.markdown:
--- title: "Public Funding for Artificial Intelligence" format: revealjs df-print: kable --- ::: {.cell} ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## Overview{.smaller} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="65%"} - Walk you through of **exploratory text analysis** for research england (UKRI Research and Innovation), which can access this from my [GitHub Page](https://fzliangfrank.github.io/invest-ai-ukri/03.html) ![all code avaible on this github page](figures/fig-welcome.png) ::: ::: {.column width="35%"} ::: {.incremental} - Some text analysis. Include usage of "Topic Model" - Sharing some insights - Discuss potential of this analytic for researchers and funding bodies. ::: ::: :::: ::: notes Thank you for your invitation for the interview. As part of the interviewing process, I produced a sample of **exploratory text** analysis for research england (UKRI Research and Innovation). Hosted as a github page. This analysis use "Topic Modeling" to analysis project description field funded AI researches. I'm going to share some of the insight and discuss potential usage for this analysis m ::: # Data Source {background-image="figures/background-getting-data.png" background-opacity=0.3} ## Data Source: GTR Project Description ::: columns ::: {.column width="0.5"} ![Search term "aritificial intelligence" has option to download csv](figures/fig-prj-desc.png) ::: ::: {.column width="0.5"} **The Data** - 5175 project descriptions contains term "artificial-intelligence" can be accessed using GtR api ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
id abstractText
FB05923A-042B-4277-AC29-67C973193C09 My PhD project addresses the important issue of how tensors (multidimensional data structures) can be employed for making sense of Big Data recorded across numerous domains in today's connected world. Namely, the proliferation of big, multidimensional data has created an ever-growing demand for innovative techniques to process such data in a computationally efficient and physically meaningful w...
E01EBC26-C27E-449B-ABEC-937373F604A9 Proteins are the workhorses of the cell, but despite significant advances in our understanding of the physical and chemical principles underlying their structures and functions, one fundamental property - protein mechanics - remains poorly understood. Mechanical forces are involved in varied biological processes such as force-bearing proteins in the muscle and tension upon chromosomes separatio...
````` ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: notes For the analysis, I gathered about 5175 project descriptions from "the Gateway of Research" website. The "Gateway of Research" is a website which let you search details about public founded research projects. In additional to project description, it also allows you to gather other project information such as time, it has been funded, or how much has been awarded. (a picture of website and a table) Description of project can be called using GTR website, the rest data I can downloading using the download button ::: ## Data Source: Additional Meta Data ::: columns ::: {.column width="0.5"} ![Search term "aritificial intelligence" has option to download csv](figures/Screenshot%202024-03-03%20at%2015.51.38.png) ::: ::: {.column width="0.5"} ### The Data {.smaller} By just search website ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Title FundingOrgName ProjectReference LeadROName Department ProjectCategory StartDate EndDate AwardPounds ExpenditurePounds Region Status id
Unravelling Enter... BBSRC BB/W020491/1 Animal and Plant Health Agency Food and Environmental Safety Research Grant 2022-05-17 2023-07-17 200860 NA North West Closed A25812AC-5977-4AA5-BE67-63D335DEE63E
Artificial Intell... Innovate UK 105048 CATCHAPP LTD NA Feasibility Studies 2019-04-01 2019-12-31 78057 NA London Closed 1B765215-F6C4-4773-A1B6-8089729A82AE
Classifying Advan... Innovate UK 84000 DIGITAL INTERRUPTION LIMITED NA Collaborative R&D 2020-11-01 2021-04-30 95138 NA North West Closed F0ACB6F0-01A9-4367-9867-04632E97F6B3
````` ::: ::: - Project Start Date - Award amount (£) ::: ::: ## Data Quality ``` r gtr_desc = read_parquet("data/gtr.parquet") |> select(id, abstractText) ## I've saved downloaded data into a parquet file gtr_meta = read_csv("data/projectsearch-1709481069771.csv") |> mutate(across(ends_with("Date"), ~as.Date(.x,"%d/%m/%Y"))) |> rename(id=ProjectId) ``` ::: columns ::: column ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Title FundingOrgName ProjectReference LeadROName Department ProjectCategory StartDate EndDate AwardPounds ExpenditurePounds Region Status id
Unravelling Enter... BBSRC BB/W020491/1 Animal and Plant Health Agency Food and Environmental Safety Research Grant 2022-05-17 2023-07-17 200860 NA North West Closed A25812AC-5977-4AA5-BE67-63D335DEE63E
Artificial Intell... Innovate UK 105048 CATCHAPP LTD NA Feasibility Studies 2019-04-01 2019-12-31 78057 NA London Closed 1B765215-F6C4-4773-A1B6-8089729A82AE
Classifying Advan... Innovate UK 84000 DIGITAL INTERRUPTION LIMITED NA Collaborative R&D 2020-11-01 2021-04-30 95138 NA North West Closed F0ACB6F0-01A9-4367-9867-04632E97F6B3
````` ::: ::: ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
id abstractText
FB05923A-042B-4277-AC29-67C973193C09 My PhD project addresses the important issue of how tensors (multidimensional data structures) can be employed for making sense of Big Data recorded across numerous domains in today's connected world. Namely, the proliferation of big, multidimensional data has created an ever-growing demand for innovative techniques to process such data in a computationally efficient and physically meaningful w...
E01EBC26-C27E-449B-ABEC-937373F604A9 Proteins are the workhorses of the cell, but despite significant advances in our understanding of the physical and chemical principles underlying their structures and functions, one fundamental property - protein mechanics - remains poorly understood. Mechanical forces are involved in varied biological processes such as force-bearing proteins in the muscle and tension upon chromosomes separatio...
````` ::: ::: ::: ::: Of the two data source - For 5175 projects, only 4453 can link together that is - Project description can contain duplicates # Data Quality - Duplicated Project ## Duplicated Due to Project Migration {.smaller} ::: {.cell} ::: Specific to this analysis is some projects can migrate from one to another. When this happens the `ProjectReference`. 97 of these will need taken out. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
ProjectReference LeadROName Title
ES/R00983X/1 University of the West of England The 'risk of risk': remodelling artificial intelligence algorithms for predicting child abuse.
ES/R00983X/2 Aston University The 'risk of risk': remodelling artificial intelligence algorithms for predicting child abuse.
````` ::: ::: Below is the code for taking out the duplicate ``` {.r code-line-numbers="6,11-16,36"} gtr_desc = read_parquet("data/gtr.parquet") |> select(id, abstractText) gtr_meta = read_csv("data/projectsearch-1709481069771.csv") |> mutate(across(ends_with("Date"), ~as.Date(.x,"%d/%m/%Y"))) |> rename(id=ProjectId) PARTIAL_PTTN='(/[1-9])$' ## waggle some columns for analytics gtr_pj = gtr_meta |> mutate( is_partial = str_detect(ProjectReference, PARTIAL_PTTN), project_ref = str_replace(ProjectReference,PARTIAL_PTTN,""), part = str_extract(ProjectReference, PARTIAL_PTTN) |> str_extract("\\d+") |> as.numeric() |> coalesce(0) ) |> # filter(is_partial) |> group_by(project_ref) |> mutate(occurance = n()) |> ungroup() |> dplyr::relocate(ProjectReference, FundingOrgName, LeadROName, id, is_partial,project_ref,part,occurance) ## early stop if this is no longer true stopifnot( "Project Reference is NOT Unique!"=length(unique(gtr_pj$ProjectReference)) == nrow(gtr_pj), "Project Refrence contain NA!"=!any(is.na(gtr_pj$ProjectReference)) ) ## find out about unique_prj = gtr_pj |> relocate(ProjectReference, project_ref, id) |> group_by(project_ref) |> mutate(rn=row_number()) |> filter(rn==1) |> select(-rn) |> ungroup() ``` ## Additional Duplicate {.smaller .scrollable} Additional\ 669 of duplicates were fund in the descriptions. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
ProjectReference abstractText
310175 Awaiting Public Project Summary
640016 Awaiting Public Project Summary
EP/X030210/1 The European microelectronics (ME) industry has a direct impact on approximately 20% of the European GDP and employs over 250,000 people, with more than 64,000 job vacancies. The main technological...
84293 Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensi...
EP/X030148/1 The European microelectronics (ME) industry has a direct impact on approximately 20% of the European GDP and employs over 250,000 people, with more than 64,000 job vacancies. The main technological...
73602 no public description
````` ::: ::: Treatment for these is taken them out all together ``` {.r code-line-numbers="10"} ## find out with text other than continuous project are repeated repeated_text = gtr_desc |> group_by(abstractText) |> mutate(n=n()) |> filter(n!=1) |> arrange(abstractText) ## Take the repeated test one out for now. analysis_prj = unique_prj |> anti_join(repeated_text, by="id") |> mutate(year = lubridate::year(StartDate)) |> inner_join(gtr_desc, by="id") ``` ## Data Reserved for Analysis {.smaller} Altogether this give us 3973 of rows for analysis. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="true" code-summary="code for balance check"} no_match = unique_prj |> anti_join(repeated_text, by="id") |> anti_join(gtr_desc,by="id") discrpency = tibble::tribble( ~"observation", ~"number of row", "Total Number of gtr_meta data", nrow(gtr_meta), "Less project migration",-n_takeout, "Taken out ",- nrow(repeated_text |> semi_join(unique_prj,"id")), "Won't have match to discription",-nrow(no_match) ) stopifnot("Discrepency Don't Add Up!"=nrow(analysis_prj)==sum(discrpency$`number of row`)) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
observation number of row
Total Number of gtr_meta data 5175
Less project migration -97
Taken out -389
Won't have match to discription -716
Total 3973
````` ::: ::: # Analysis {background-image="figures/background-analysis.png" background-opacity=0.3} ## Project Trend Overview {auto-animate=true} ::: {.r-hstack} ![](figures/fig-trend.png){width="90%"} ![](figures/fig-word-trend.png){width="90%"} ::: ![](figures/fig-elite-project.png){width="45%"} ## Keyword Mentions {auto-animate=true} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="0.65"} ![](figures/fig-word-trend.png){width="90%"} ```{.r code-line-numbers="3"} ## digest paragram into words title_word_by_year = analysis_prj |> tokenize_words_group(title, year) ## visualisation title_word_by_year |> plt_style_change( ... ``` ::: ::: {.column width="0.35"} ```{.r code-line-numbers="2,5-11"} ## function for tokenise target fiel tokenize_words_group = function(df, col, group_col) { df |> # preserve chained keywords mutate(text_field = str_replace({{col}}, '(A|a)rtificial (I|i)ntelligence', 'artificialintelligence') |> str_replace("machine learning", 'machinelearning') ) |> unnest_tokens(word,text_field, token="words") |> anti_join(stop_words,"word") |> mutate(word=str_replace(word,'artificialintelligence','artificial-intelligence') |> str_replace('machinelearning','machin-learning') ) |> group_by(word, {{group_col}}) |> summarise(n_prj = length(unique(ProjectId)), .groups="drop" ) |> arrange(desc({{group_col}}),desc(n_prj)) |> ungroup() } ``` ::: :::: ::: aside next plot to zoom in ::: ## Insights {auto-animate=true} ![](figures/fig-word-trend.png){width="90%"} # Topic Modeling {background-image="figures/cover-tm.png" background-opacity=0.3} ## What is Topic Modeling - The process of Extracting Themes from large document - Frist step in topic modeling is convert text into *document-term matrix* - Topic Model Algorithm such as LDA compares similarity between document by comparing propotion word frequencies. ![](figures/topic-model.png){width="90%"} ## On Our Data{.smaller .scrollable} :::: {.columns} Apply these description data our topic, and take 10 topics out. ::: {.column width="0.5"} ```{.r} ## word count histogram abstract_words = analysis_prj |> unnest_tokens(word,abstractText) |> anti_join(stop_words) ## word count abstract_word_count = abstract_words |> count(word,id,sort=T) ## create document term matrix gtr_dtm = abstract_word_count |> cast_dtm(id,word,n) ## create alda modeling topics = gtr_dtm |> topicmodels::LDA(k=10) ``` ::: ::: {.column width="0.5"} ::: {.cell} ::: **beta** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} beta = topics |> tidy("beta") beta |> head(3) |> kbl2() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
topic term beta
1 amp 0.0027870
2 amp 0.0004771
3 amp 0.0000829
````` ::: ::: **gamma** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gamma = topics |> tidy("gamma") gamma |> head(3) |> kbl2() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
document topic gamma
7D030DE3-A4B9-45B9-8C32-04A4C246E933 1 0.6638977
848C12F5-FE3A-442E-A13C-E796468A3396 1 0.0001376
C2A76562-29C1-4CD1-BEDE-2AD2E56BDC78 1 0.0001244
````` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Helper: Understand `beta` & `gamma` {.smaller} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} Sum of **beta** for each **topic** equal 1 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sum_beta=beta |> group_by(topic) |> summarise(n=sum(beta)) stopifnot(all(round(sum_beta$n,2) ==1.00)) sum_beta |> kbl2() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
topic n
1 1
2 1
3 1
4 1
5 1
6 1
7 1
8 1
9 1
10 1
````` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} Sum of **gamma** for each **document** equal 1 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-summary="Sum of gamma for each document equal 1"} sum_gamma=gamma |> group_by(document) |> summarise(n=sum(gamma)) stopifnot(all(round(sum_gamma$n,2) ==1.00)) sum_gamma |> head(2) |> kbl2() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
document n
000B1EC5-8655-498F-A9E3-AF5A173AD61F 1
000FBDEE-B3A9-43BB-A055-6F6ADF9FC292 1
````` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Topic Against Funding Type ```{.r code-line-numbers="2-4"} ## finding the most representative gamma topic_binded = topics |> tidy("gamma") |> filter(gamma > 0.8) |> # 0.8 is a number we can be sure there is only one topic # for one document rename(id=document) |> left_join(analysis_prj, "id") ## creating graphics topic_binded |> select(topic, ProjectCategory) |> mutate(topic_chr=fct_inorder(as.character(topic)) ) |> complete(topic_chr,ProjectCategory) |> ggplot() + geom_bin2d(aes(x=topic_chr, y = ProjectCategory)) + theme_minimal() + scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "F",trans="sqrt") + ggtitle("Topic Against Porject Category") + coord_equal() ``` ::: notes One thing we can do is for each topic, selecting gamma higher than 0.8 ::: ## Topic Against Funding Type {auto-animate=true .scrollable} ![](figures/fig-topic-vs-category.png) ::: notes The topic modeling are in fact picking up different types of topics. Particularly “Studentship” is extracted as topic 2, “Collaborative R & D” is almost exclusively extracted as topic 10. ::: **Topic 2 & 10** ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Topic 2 ![](figures/fig-topic2.png) ### Topic 10 ![](figures/fig-topic10.png) ::: ::: notes topic 3 seems to be describe about “machine learning”. One of the hot words. It makes no surprise that some how related to student ship. topic 8, topic 9 both are very scientific. As we can see the description are very scientific and specific to particular field. ::: # Potential Usage

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
